title: Incidental Gallbladder Cancer
diagnosis_topic: T2 Gallbladder Adenocarcinoma Discovered on Pathology
setup_script: A 65-year-old woman underwent laparoscopic cholecystectomy for symptomatic gallstones. She recovered well postoperatively. One week later, the pathology report reveals an incidental pT2 gallbladder adenocarcinoma invading the perimuscular connective tissue. You are asked to see her in clinic to discuss further management. How would you proceed?

dynamic_flow.reply: Gallbladder removed intact, no bile spillage. Cystic duct margin was negative on frozen section.
CT chest/abdomen/pelvis shows no distant metastasis. MRCP shows no common bile duct involvement.
For T2 disease, hepatic bed resection (segments IVB/V) with hepatoduodenal ligament lymphadenectomy is indicated. Please describe your operative technique in detail.

dynamic_flow.trigger: If resident describes operative steps (hepatic wedge resection, lymphadenectomy, margin assessment)
dynamic_flow.reply: Operation is completed successfully without complications. What are your immediate postoperative considerations?
What else would you include in your operative approach?

dynamic_flow.trigger: If resident delays reoperation beyond 6 weeks
dynamic_flow.reply: The patient develops new liver lesions on follow-up imaging. What are your concerns now?

dynamic_flow.trigger: If resident states simple cholecystectomy alone is sufficient
dynamic_flow.reply: Recurrence risk is high. How would you address this with the patient?
Cystic duct margin is negative. How does this affect your surgical decision making?

dynamic_flow.trigger: If resident considers bile duct excision
dynamic_flow.reply: Extrahepatic bile duct excision is not performed unless the margin is positive. What is your plan?

dynamic_flow.trigger: If resident refers to medical oncology
dynamic_flow.reply: Medical oncology is consulted. What adjuvant treatment considerations are there?
Five-year survival ranges from 60–80% if completely resected early. How would you counsel the patient?
What surveillance schedule would you recommend after resection?
What risk factors are associated with gallbladder cancer?
Which specialties would you involve in her care?

Description of operative technique for extended cholecystectomy
Timing of reoperation to minimize tumor spread
Postoperative surveillance and adjuvant therapy considerations
Patient counseling regarding prognosis and risk factors

rubric.resident_feedback_template: Strengths:You demonstrated strong diagnostic reasoning by appropriately interpreting the incidental cancer finding and pursuing staging workup. Your recognition of the need for extended resection showed solid clinical judgment. Areas for Improvement:Earlier discussion of the importance of timing for reoperation would strengthen your management plan. Consider being more structured when outlining surveillance and adjuvant therapy recommendations.
